Linux commands

Jan 2, 2018

This post is about Linux commands

ls

List all files in current folder

ls [options] [folder]

List all files in [folder] with some [options]

cd [path]

Change current working directory to [path]

cd

Back to root folder of current folder

rm [file]

Detele [file]

rm [file] [folder's path]

Move [file] to [folder]

rm [filename1] [filename2]

Change name of [filename1] to [filename2]

chmod [options] [file]

Change file’s permission

df

Show disk usage

chown [option] [user]:[group] [file/folder]

Change file owner and group
